content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on the great jug with your right hand, with a gaston left hand for the start. Move left to a great crack. From the deep crack jump to the top. An instant classic.
content.location: On the main face just left of the right arete.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on the good flake on the left of the arete and with options for your right hand. Go up the arete. There is literally a perfect hand hold most of the way up the arete. An instant classic.
content.location: The arete on the left side of the main climbing face.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a sidepull above the moss and a second sidepull 1.5 ft right of that.Â  Throw up for the perfect pinch with your right hand. An instant classic.
content.location: Look for the deep double crack that you use for the pinch towards the top of the boulder. Left of middle of the face.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on the arete with your left hand in a jug on the left, and a low right hand on your right. Throw up for the pocket with a great pinch inside of it then go for the top. An instant classic.
content.location: Climbs the arete on the right side of the face.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start is a horizontal and pocket to the right of the flake. Make your first move onto the flake. Follow the flake to the top. An instant classic.
content.location: Look for the flake to the right of the right arete. The start is on the horizontal to the right of the flake.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a sidepull and move up through a rectangular feature with cracks on the left and right side. Make a hop to the finish if you need to. An instant classic.
content.location: Starts on a flat sidepull a couple feet to the right of the left arete.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on sidepulls that make up the vertical cracks of a rectangular feature. Bump up your right hand. You can find some pockets and go for the top but it's probably easier to hop from the bump. An instant classic.
content.location: Look for deep vertical cracks in the middle of the face.
